edu.umass.cs.reconfiguration.reconfigurationutils

Class DemandProfile

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umass.cs.reconfiguration.reconfigurationutils.AbstractDemandProfile
      • edu.umass.cs.reconfiguration.reconfigurationutils.DemandProfile

  • public class DemandProfile
extends AbstractDemandProfile
    Author:
    V. Arun This sample implementation of AbstractDemandProfile maintains the demand profile for a single name and returns it as a JSONObject via its getStats() method. The specification of its methods is in the documentation of AbstractDemandProfile.

      • register

        public void register(Request request,
                     InetAddress sender,
                     edu.umass.cs.reconfiguration.reconfigurationutils.InterfaceGetActiveIPs nodeConfig)
        This method is used to inform the reconfiguration policy that request received from a client at IP address sender. The parameter nodeConfig provides the list of all active replica locations. The reconfiguration policy may use this information to assimilate a demand distribution and use that to determine whether and how to reconfigure the current set of replicas. The simplistic example below ignores the sender information that in general is needed to determine the geo-distribution of demand.
        Specified by:
        register in class AbstractDemandProfile

      • getRequestRate

        public double getRequestRate()
        Returns:
        Request rate for the service name.

      • getNumRequests

        public double getNumRequests()
        Returns:
        Number of requests for this service name since the most recent demand report was sent to reconfigurators.

      • getNumTotalRequests

        public double getNumTotalRequests()
        Returns:
        Total number of requests for this service name.

      • shouldReport

        public boolean shouldReport()
        Description copied from class: AbstractDemandProfile
        A policy that tells whether it is time to report from an active replica to a reconfigurator. Actives in general should not report upon every request, but at some coarser frequency to limit overhead.
        Specified by:
        shouldReport in class AbstractDemandProfile
        Returns:
        Whether the active replica should send a demand report to the reconfigurator.

      • getStats

        public org.json.JSONObject getStats()
        Description copied from class: AbstractDemandProfile
        All relevant stats must be serializable into JSON. Any information not included in the returned JSONObject will not be available for use in the reconfiguration policy in AbstractDemandProfile.shouldReconfigure(ArrayList, InterfaceGetActiveIPs).
        Specified by:
        getStats in class AbstractDemandProfile
        Returns:
        Demand statistics as JSON.

      • combine

        public void combine(AbstractDemandProfile dp)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDemandProfile
        Combine the new information in update into this. This method is used at reconfigurators to combine a newly received demand report with an existing demand report.
        Specified by:
        combine in class AbstractDemandProfile

      • shouldReconfigure

        public ArrayList<InetAddress> shouldReconfigure(ArrayList<InetAddress> curActives,
                                                edu.umass.cs.reconfiguration.reconfigurationutils.InterfaceGetActiveIPs nodeConfig)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDemandProfile
        The main reconfiguration policy
        Specified by:
        shouldReconfigure in class AbstractDemandProfile
        Returns:
        The list of new IP addresses for the new placement. Returning null means no reconfiguration will happen. Returning a list that is the same as curActives means that a trivial reconfiguration will happen unless ReconfigurationConfig.RC.RECONFIGURE_IN_PLACE is set to false. If the returned list is different from curActives, a new list must be created within this method; the supplied curActives must not be modified.

      • justReconfigured

        public void justReconfigured()
        Description copied from class: AbstractDemandProfile
        Tells us that the current demand profile was just used to perform reconfiguration. This is useful for implementing policies based on the difference between the current demand profile and the one at the time of the most recent reconfiguration, e.g., reconfigure only if the demand from some region has changed by more than 10%.
        Specified by:
        justReconfigured in class AbstractDemandProfile
